__Aiko Matsuyama__ is a Japanese color designer and digital painter, who mainly does finishing.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/codamasaori) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/codamasaori/)

__Website | Twitter | Instagram | YouTube__ Introduction: Halca is a Japanese musician affiliated with company Music Ray'n and signed to label Sacra Music. She had a major appearance as the opening act during the CHiCO with HoneyWorks 2017 tour. In 2018 she released her first single called "Kimi no Tonari", which was used as the ending theme for the anime "Wotakoi: Love is Hard for Otaku". Her other appearances have been in anime such as: Ace Attorney, Kaguya-sama: Love is War and We Never Learn!: BOKUBEN Season 2 Biography: Halca started with an interest in music from early childhood. She was heavily inspired when she one day received a copy of the song "Again" by YUI. While in junior high school, she discovered that her home's cable TV had an anime channel, which is also the way she became familiar with anime music in general. She would watch this anime channel on a daily basis, which slowly began to impact her future plans. The biggest impact from the several anime shows she watched in her childhood, were shows such as Cardcaptor Sakura and Toradora!. The anime that had the biggest musical influence ended up being the song "Kiss Kara Hajimaru Miracle" from the anime Steel Angel Kurumi, which became her favorite anime song. She decided to join her school's choir club and broadcast theater club later on to hone her vocal skills, as she started to take an approach to singing herself. After honing her skills in school she officially decided to pursue a career as a musician. Halca had a lot of singing auditions to consider, but the audition that piqued her interest the most was for the Utakatsu! Audition, which focused on anime songs. She decided to participate in the audition for Utakatsu!, and she ended up winning the grand prize in 2013. She didn't let win go to her head, however, as after the winning the audition she continued to train her vocal skills while waiting to make her major debut. In 2017 she was invited by the singer CHiCO, known primarily for her involvement in the group HoneyWorks (alongside Gom, Shito and Yamako), to perform in the latter's 2017 live tour as their opening act. Following her opening act, she performed the song "Kimi no Sora" ("Your Sky"), which was included in a compilation album released to celebrate the 10th anniversary of the online novel publisher Noichigo. She also performed with the song "Resonator", which was used in the original soundtrack for the anime series "Beatless", and she also made a mini-album titled White Disc, which was sold during the HoneyWorks tour. Halca made her major debut later in 2018, with the release of her first single "Kimi no Tonari" ("Next to You"), which was used as the ending theme for the anime Wotakoi: Love is Hard for Otaku. To commemorate the release of her first single, the mini-album White Disc was made available for sale during the single's release event. Her second single "Starting Blue" was released in October 2018, with the title track being used as the ending theme for the second season of the anime Ace Attorney. Her third single "Sentimental Crisis" was released in February 2019, the title track was used as the ending theme for the anime Kaguya-sama: Love is War. Her fourth single "Houkago no Liberty" was released on November 13, 2019, the title track was used as the ending theme to the anime We Never Learn!: BOKUBEN Season 2. (Source: [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Halca), edited)
Website | Twitter Japanese arranger, composer, and lyricist.

Website Collaboration Study is a seiyuu collaboration that was made for the anime Bokutachi wa Benkyou ga Dekinai, which features Haruka Shiraishi, Sayumi Suzushiro and Miyu Tomita (as Fumino Furuhashi, Uruka Takemoto and Rizu Ogata respectively). They performed with the song "Seishun Seminar" as the opening theme, while also performing "Never Give It Up!!" as the ending theme. The collaboration performed once again for the second season of Bokutachi wa Benkyou ga Dekinai, reasonably titled Bokutachi wa Benkyou ga Dekinai 2, but this time Lynn and Madoka Asahina were added to the line-up. Lynn features Mafuyu Kirisu in the show, while Madoka Asahina feature as Asumi Kominami. In this season of the show they performed the song "Can Now, Can Now" which aired as the opening theme, while the ending theme was performed by halca. (Source: boku-ben.com)

Website | Twitter Japanese arranger, composer, and lyricist.

[Official Website ](http://www.mami-kawada.jp/) | [Twitter ](https://twitter.com/mamikawada) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/5MqHx3rECV1BvBBFG3L508?autoplay=true) 

Mami Kawada is a former Japanese pop singer and lyricist who was signed to NBCUniversal Entertainment Japan and also a member of I've Sound, a musical group which produces soundtracks for eroge (erotic games) and anime.

Kawada made her musical debut in 2001 after being discovered by her music teacher [Eiko Shimamiya](https://anilist.co/staff/100243/Eiko-Shimamiya) with the release of the song "Kaze to Kimi o Daite". She released her first single, a split-single with musician [KOTOKO](https://anilist.co/staff/100076/KOTOKO), in 2002, and her first solo single was released in 2005. Her first album, Seed, was released in 2006. She first performed overseas in Taiwan in 2007 and later appeared at the Bangkok Comic Con in Thailand in 2014.

Kawada's songs have been featured as theme music for various anime shows such as the Shakugan no Shana and A Certain Magical Index series. She has performed theme songs for various eroge such as Love, Election and Chocolate and Aokana: Four Rhythm Across the Blue. She has also written songs for other musicians. During the LisAni 2016 event, Kawada announced her retirement from singing activities following a final concert in May 2016.

__Agency:__ Toy's Factory

[ToysFactory Profile](https://www.toysfactory.co.jp/artist/harukashiraishi/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/shiraishi-haruka/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/shiraharu48?s=09)

Haruka Shiraishi is a Japanese actress and voice actress. She was previously affiliated with Hirata Office, but is currently affiliated with Toy's Factory.

- Rupee - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Folkwang - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Blücher - Azur Lane
- Agano - Azur Lane
- Le Malin - Azur Lane
- Erina - Tevi (VG)
- Grace Howard - Zenless Zone Zero (VG)

[Profile](http://artist.amuse.co.jp/artist/tomita_miyu/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/miyu-tomita/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/miyju_tomita) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tomita__miyu._/)

The Grand Prix winner of the 2014 Seiyuu Artist Training Program Selection competition, which was sponsored by Amuse and Ken Production. After being scouted by six talent agencies, she eventually joined Amuse.

She made her voice acting debut in 2015, voicing a number of unnamed characters in Himouto Umaru-chan.

Non-Anime Roles
• Layla - Genshin Impact (VG)
• Zara - Memento Mori (VG)
• New Jersey - Azur Lane (VG)
• Jiu Niangzi - Reverse: 1999 (VG)
